fields.description:
Traditionally, once a users accidentally tries to login with his/her e-mail alias. The following actions take effect:

* Request for Sign-up for a new Bitbucket account
* E-mail sent to the user who had the alias stating that another user claimed the e-mail and there was a change in the account

This causes quite a bit of confusion among the users and here are the concerns:

* They feel insecure and compromised from the e-mail message
* They are sometimes unaware that they are trying to login via alias
* They end up with 2 accounts and on logging in with the second account to see it new and empty may cause an alarm or panic to see their data missing (which is not the case and would exist in another account)

I believe that the error messages that we are delivered to users needs to alert them on the alias situation and thus prevent creation of multiple accounts.
fields.summary: Better Error Message for E-mail alias based sign-up for Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description: What prompted this request is that I have email filters that categorize all my Jira notifications depending on what has happened. So if I receive general emails that say someone has pushed code I mark it. If I receive an email that the pull request has been merged I mark it.  This allows me to quickly tell which pull requests I still need to checkup up on. I think it would be beneficial to receive and email saying I approved a pull request so that I can mark it and quickly tell which pull request I still need to look at. Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow Email Notifications for Actions Made by Yourself

h3. Suggested Solution
Users would like to see in the email notification an indication that the build has failed due to a System Error, to be able to differentiate with builds that have failed for other reasons.
fields.summary: Differentiate 'system error' failures from other pipeline failures in email notifications

fields.description:
YML anchors are useful for referencing and reusing common configuration in the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file however you can’t use them to merge arrays ([https://github.com/yaml/yaml/issues/35|https://github.com/yaml/yaml/issues/35]). Due to this limitation it’s not possible to reference a subset of commands in the script list, for example:

{code}
configure_settings: &configure_settings
  - pipe: docker://atlassian/download-settings:1.0
  - ./copy-settings-to-user-home.sh

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - *configure_settings
          - echo "unique command 1"
    - step:
        script:
          - *configure_settings
          - echo "unique command 2"
{code}

Another way to extract and reuse common operations is to use [pipes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/pipes-958765631.html] however pipes are run in a separate docker container to the main build container and so common script executed within a pipe can not affect the build environment (such as environment variables and files outside the build directory). As a workaround users have been partially extracting an operation to a pipe and running additional commands afterwards to complete the operation. Furthermore these commands still need to be duplicated in every step, for example:

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - pipe: docker://atlassian/download-settings:1.0
          - ./copy-settings-to-user-home.sh
          - echo "unique command 1"
    - step:
        script:
          - pipe: docker://atlassian/download-settings:1.0
          - ./copy-settings-to-user-home.sh
          - echo "unique command 2"
{code}

If pipes were allowed to execute in the build container, the full operation could be extracted to the pipe. A containerless pipe could of course still execute a docker run command to bring in additional tooling solving both requirements.

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - pipe: docker://atlassian/configure-settings:1.0
          - echo "unique command 1"
    - step:
        script:
          - pipe: docker://atlassian/configure-settings:1.0
          - echo "unique command 2"
{code}
fields.summary: Add support for container-less pipes (shared scripts that execute in the build container)

fields.description:
*Problem description*

In our bitbucket-pipelines, we define a pipeline to run on a pull request for every `feature/*` branch.

We open a pull request to merge branch `feature/A` into master, and pipelines are triggered fine for every pushed commit.

Since feature A is a very big feature, a coworker decides to help, and branches of `feature/A2` from `feature/A`.

Feature A2 is ready, so we decide to merge `feature/A2` into `feature/A`. This adds a merge commit on top of `feature/A`, but a pipeline is not triggered.

Now if I merge `feature/A2` into `feature/A` locally, and then push the merge commit, the PR pipeline does trigger.

*Expected behavior*

A pipeline is triggered for every change in the source branch of the PR.

*Actual behavior*

A merge via BitBucket into the source branch of an open PR does not trigger the pipeline registered for that PR.
fields.summary: Cascaded pull request does not trigger pipelines as expected on UI merge

fields.description:
Previously there was API 1.0 for repositories privileges management and currently, it's not available in API 2.0

It would be great if Bitbucket team can hold off the privileges management for API 1.0 until it's ready on API 2.0
fields.summary: No API 2.0 for repositories permission

fields.description: I set a variable for a deployment stage (e.g. {{COOKIE_DOMAIN}} in the {{staging}} environment). Using the variable in a script in a step works correctly, but the variable is undefined if I try to use it in a parallel step.
fields.summary: Deployment variables are not set in parallel pipeline step

fields.description:
We have configured Jira / Bitbucket integration.  When we make a commit that references the Jira ticket, in Jira the issue is updated and a link to the commit is generated.

On bitbucket, the commit message is not linked on the source page within the repository.

It is linked if you open up branches, or the commits page.
fields.summary: Commit Messages linked to JIRA do not have hyperlinks in source page

fields.description: During long PR review some time it takes more than one day to finish whole PR and due to that sometime it is hard to track how many files got reviewed. If we have feature which allow as to mark each file as reviewed then easy for us to track. Also, along with that if developer update code in that file then again that file should show new changes.
fields.summary: Each individual file should have mark approved feature during PR review

fields.description:
my repo is over the size limit

i try to commit file removal → it doesn’t work

i try to remove file online → a message “something went wrong” is displayed

‌

How can i do please

Thank you
fields.summary: online deletion do not work

fields.description:
I see one can include markdown in commit message. I understand this can be useful to many people.

However, in our team we have the convention of prefixing every commit message with a hashtag and the ticket number the commit relates to (e.g. “#4242 - Fix whatever”). Bitbucket then displays this as a H1 level header, which was never our intention.

!2507228088-image.png|thumbnail!\\
It would be nice if there was some way to disable this.
fields.summary: Disable markdown in commit messages

fields.description:
In order to update my websites I have set up git pulls to my Bitbucket repo and did create some ssh keys and added them to the repo.\\
But now I only see one SSH although I have set several ones.\\
And if I want to re-add the previously SSH key from a couple of weeks ago Bitbucket tells me that it is still in use (but doesn’t tell me where).

What can I do?

‌

Regards, Stephan
fields.summary: SSH Keys of Repos not shown but still used

fields.description:
Since most gaming companies are working with game engines most of the time are dealing with rather large binaries/assets in the project. Mediafiles & Meta-data are already stored in Git LFS but still they are in need of more space.

So the request here is to provide a greater size repositories at a higher cost or over a different plan tier exclusively for game-developers
fields.summary: Request for Game-Dev Tier On Bitbucket

fields.description:
Hi,

We were trying to upgrade our plan to paid version and while filling up our details in the address section we entered Maharashtra as state in the state field and country as India. However the system gives error stating invalid state and was not allowing us to proceed.

But when we selected British Indian Ocean Territory it allowed Maharashtra as the state. This is an serious error.

Attaching screenshots
fields.summary: Upgrade Plan - Valid State shown in invalid country

fields.description: I have created private repository. Even though commits found from the users which is not in the group or team of repository. How its possible ? what should be done to prevent access and commit from the user which is not in the team or users of repository ?
fields.summary: Repository access violation

fields.description:
When I look at my list of commits in the web UI, it is showing that there are NO commits in my master or development branches.  There should be close to 4,000 commits.  I still have the full commit chain on my local repo, but Bitbucket seems to have lost them on origin.

This has happened in my android repo.  All my other repos are fine.
fields.summary: master and development branches disappeared

fields.description: When the user comment in a issue inside Bitbucket Cloud through e-mail, the notification e-mail isn’t being triggered to the watchers of the issue.
fields.summary: E-mail of comments on Issues aren't triggering e-mail notification.

fields.description:
as a PR reviewer , i want to quickly jump to comments section so i can quickly review them,\\
now if i have long description ( which could be genereated by merging two major feature branches ) , i have to scroll down all the way till the overview description ends, then i can start seeing comments and changed files.

I think we should add a button to collapse overview description area, so that user can quickly jump to comment/ changed files and do the real work :smiley:

!264415826-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: add a button to collapse  PR overview  description or to jump to comments/change files  section

fields.description:
When viewing the Pull Request (PR) Overview screen, when I hover a reviewer’s avatar in the ribbon of PR reviewers' avatars, a helpful tooltip pops up with “So & So updated this pull request 40 minutes ago” and similar. However, when a reviewer has _not_ updated the PR at all, her/his default status consistently appears as “So & So updated this pull request just now,” which is incorrect and misleading.

Separately (but I’m lazy to create this as a Feature Request): While in this same section of the UI, it would be nice to see at a glance what or when the latest PR update was-- not tucked away under hover tooltip but right up front as an important thing.
fields.summary: Pull request review: Incorrect "Joe Blow updated this pull request just now" status when any reviewer hasn't yet touched the PR.

fields.description:
I would like to put the restriction to the development team where the developers should not create a feature branches from release branches?

Reason- In my application some times the developers are creating feature branches from release branch but eventually they have to take DEVELOP branch only? how to put the condition in bitbucket?
fields.summary: when the developers are creating the feature branch they shouldn't create from release branch? is there any kind of restriction we can apply in bitbucket?

fields.description: I deleted the MinecraftModArchive team and it still appears on my account. If I click the link, I get a 404 error…and using Sourcetree to list my  repos fails because of this broken link.
fields.summary: Deleted team still remains on account

fields.description: Fortran src-code with “f90” is called (in section File details) incorrectly “Fortrain” and broke the Fortran highlighting
fields.summary: Incorrect file type broke the highlighting system

fields.description:
As per the title, when using the PUT method, if a Content-Type:application/json header is included, the call will return a "Bad request" error.

This is not consistent with other methods such as DELETE, which does not throw this error even though it also does not support JSON parameters.

The affected API endpoint is this one:\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/default-reviewers/%7Btarget_username%7D
fields.summary: Default reviewer PUT method throws bad request if JSON content type header is included

fields.description: I have a suite of mobile UI tests running on pipelines (integrated with AWS Device farm), this suite some time takes more than 120 minutes to finish, and fails due to the timeout issue. Is there a way I can ignore the timeout and continue waiting for the tests to finish? If not, can one be build?
fields.summary: Increase step max time limit (more than 120mins)

fields.description:
We had an issue recently where we created a pull request in Bitbucket and merged the changes through. However a couple of lines which had changed did not appear in the PR and subsequently did not make it through to our main branch after the merge.

We managed to work around this by making the change to the same lines and the same file in the same branch on another machine and repeating the process.

I am able to replicate this issue by creating new branches from the most recent commits on the branches from the time and creating a new PR and again we can see in Bitbucket cloud that in one branch it has the additional lines and in the other branch they are missing, and yet in the PR the changes aren’t showing.

I can provide the details for the branches / PR if needed for this to be investigated.
fields.summary: Changes not being picked up during pull-request.

fields.description: Some customers may experience an intermittent issue with webhooks, therefore it would be a useful feature if we could enable and keep the logs permanently or at least for a longer period of time.
fields.summary: Permanently enable request history collection

fields.description:
Hi,

When you create a branch it doesn’t always use the last commit from the origin branch.

For example, i push a commit, i do a check in Bitbucket commits sections, the last commit appears but when create a branch it automatically uses the previous commit and there is no way to see when you create the branch what commit it uses.

I have to delete the branch and create it again, in this way it uses the last commit, it
fields.summary: branch creation

fields.description:
I’m running a test suite on some C++ code using CTest and Catch2. When the test fails, I don’t see the Junit output of the test on the Pipelines dashboard.

The test exports a file such as the one attached. I tried placing it in various places under various names, but the result is always the same:

{code}
Skipping cache upload for failed step
Searching for test report files in directories named [test-results, failsafe-reports, test-reports, surefire-reports] down to a depth of 4
Finished scanning for test reports. Found 0 test report files.
Merged test suites, total number tests is 0, with 0 failures and 0 errors.
{code}

In my last attempt, I placed the file as build/test-reports/importexport.xml

Pls let me know if the attached file is a suitable file for consuming by Pipelines, and what would a correct path be.

‌

Thanks,

Uri.
fields.summary: pipelines - cannot display Catch2/CTest test results

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I’ve have the following issue: I have activated te branching model and enable the release type branch, but when I create a release branch from main branch, Bitbucket shows me a message: “We couldn’t create a branch.“
fields.summary: Can't create release branch using branching model

fields.description: If a build is started from a PR where the source branch matches a branch that is allowed to deploy on the deployment branch permissions, this build will not allow proceeding with deployment, despite matching the branch on the deployment branch permissions.
fields.summary: (BBS-109950) Pipelines doesn't allow deployments through builds if PR's source branch matches the branch restriction.

fields.description:
When I block the request for branching-model, the time of page load decreases with 50%\\
Can this be somehow optimized? PR listing takes 20 seconds now.
fields.summary: Branching model creates slow loading time on PR listing

fields.description:
Pre-Requisites

* Bitbucket Cloud repository
* Azure pipeline, with trigger configured on both pull request validation and changes on master

‌

Repro Steps

* Create a pull request, a build is triggered on Azure DevOps side
* Edit the file with the UI in Bitbucket, then commit it, there on Azure DevOps side, 2 builds are triggered.

‌

Thanks,
fields.summary: Two builds triggered while using Azure Pipelines in Pull Request

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Open a team.
# Go to team settings.
# Click “delete account”. *
# Get returned to home page.
# Click on avatar at bottom of nav bar.
# Menu still contains deleted team.

* Seems like this might delete my Atlassian account but actually deletes the team workspace.
fields.summary: Team still appears in menu after being deleted

fields.description: I have deleted repo named {{product-test}}, but it appears in my repo list with empty content in. When i've tried to create new one i’ve got message that this repo already exists.
fields.summary: Couldn't create new repo with old repo name

fields.description: At this moment it is not possible to filter the results on *Users on plan* and *User groups*. To find a specific user, it's necessary to go over all results – page by page – until you can find what you are looking for. It would be good to have the functionality to search for the users.
fields.summary: Add ability to search for users on Users on plan

fields.description: Please find UX work for LMS project

fields.description:
Currently, API v1 for Wiki has been removed.

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/deprecation-notice-v1-apis/#wiki

*Feature Request*:

It would be best to have an API 2.0 Wiki endpoints equivalent from V1.
fields.summary: Support API 2.0 for Wiki

fields.description:
In order to match our security practices, we would like to have the ability to set, on the "Build Setup", different values to the "umask" and "chmod" variables.

This impact our deployments since, we need to manually update the permission of the files and folders before we deploy our builds, in order to avoid malicious scripts in our application directory.
fields.summary: We need the ability to change the default "umask" and "chmod" of our Pipelines builds (PTGS-5190)

fields.description:
am trying to get all the comments in an issue, in API 1.0 I can get all the comments which have the comment content, after API 2.0 the API call returns all the comments includes attachment activities, issue comment status activity. For example one of my issue have actual 5 comments, remaining 8 comments are attachment, edited description, Changed title. but on the API return these kind of activities are not returned just content.raw objects are empty, so I am not able to show only comments

i am trying to get the comments of an issue using following call

{code}
/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/issues/{issue_id}/comments
{code}

also here [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/issues/%7Bissue_id%7D/comments#get|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/issues/%257Bissue_id%257D/comments#get]

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The app switcher in Safari does not show a link to the JIRA instance that is connected with the account

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect your Bitbucket Cloud account with a JIRA Cloud instance as per the instructions here https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/connect-bitbucket-cloud-to-jira-software-cloud-814190686.html
# After you finish the integration, go to bitbucket.org in Safari and select the applications switcher

h3. Expected Results
The application switcher shows a link to the JIRA instance:

!1598172595-Screen%20Shot%202019-07-03%20at%2010.54.21.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The application switcher has a link *Jira TRY* that links to this page: https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/bitbucket-integration

!1517917773-Screen%20Shot%202019-07-03%20at%2010.54.09.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
The workaround at the moment is for the user to log out and then log back in to JIRA
fields.summary: The app switcher in Safari does not show a link to a connected JIRA Cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Make sure you are logged out of bitbucket.org

Then go to id.atlassian.com and log in.\\
The following page shows:\\
!1969285929-Screen%20Shot%202019-07-03%20at%2011.01.29.png|thumbnail!

If I select JIRA, I am automatically logged in to my JIRA instance

If I select Bitbucket, the following page shows and I need to select 'Log in' again:\\
!3640808568-Screen%20Shot%202019-07-03%20at%2011.02.26.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
When a user logs in to id.atlassian.com, log them in to their Bitbucket account as well
fields.summary: After logging in to id.atlassian.com log in the user to bitbucket.org as well

fields.description:
Same issue as BCLOUD-16985

h3. *Summary*
*Resource Owner Password Credentials Grant* (4.3) has stopped working recently.\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/oauth-2/

Steps to reproduce:

{code}
#!CURL

$ curl -X POST -u "client_id:secret" \
       https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/access_token -d grant_type=password \
       -d username=my_username -d password=my_password
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   148  100    93  100    55     59     35  0:00:01  0:00:01 --:--:--    94{"error_description": "Invalid resource owner username/password", "error": "invalid_request"}

{code}

h3. *Expected Results*
Password Credentials Grant Rest API should be working

h3. *Actual Results*
Password Credentials Grant Rest API stopped working

h3. *Workaround*
Use a different grant type to proceed further:\\
For example:

{code}
#!CURL  
  
curl -X POST -u "client_id:secret" \
  https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/access_token \
  -d grant_type=client_credential
{code}
fields.summary: OAuth 2.0 authentication: grant_type=password stopped working

fields.description:
I tried cloning a repository which is a http server. But Bitbucket is trying to connect to https server which doesn’t exist and is rejecting the credentials.

As per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/securing-bitbucket-server-with-tomcat-using-ssl-776640127.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/securing-bitbucket-server-with-tomcat-using-ssl-776640127.html] the Bitbucket is configured to HTTPS-only access is what I could determine.

Please let me know how do I allow the http connection
fields.summary: Not able to clone a repository
